|cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = MIPS 24KEc |cpu1_type_rev = |cpu1spd = 360 |is_doc = |bus = |flash1type = |fla1_num = |fla1chip = |flash1size = |flash1maxsize = |ram1type = |ram1type1 = |ram1spd = |ram1size = 32 |ram1chip = EtronTech;EM63A165TS-6G; |ram1_num = |nvramsize = |eth_cpu = true |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 100MbE |ethstandard = |auto_mdix = |sup_jumbo = |ethoui = 9C:41:7C |oui = 9C:41:7C |bootwait = |stockbootloader = |stockos = |exp_if_types = |exp_sim_num = |exp_pcmcia_num = |exp_expcard_num = |exp_minipci_num = |exp_minipcie_num = |exp_usb_num = |exp_cf_num = |exp_sdmmc_num = |exp_ide_num = |exp_ata_num = |exp_sata_num = |exp_esata_num = |exp_parallel = |exp_sfp_num = |exp_M.2 = |usb_hub = |pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 1.2 |pwr_conn = USB Female Mini-B |serial = |jtag = |specialfeat = |flags = 3G capable,battery,portable |addchip = |802dot11_protocols = bgn |defaulip = 192.168.169.1 |defaultlogin = |defaultpass = hame |defaultssid = HAME_A1_XXXX |defaultssid_regex = ^HAME_A1_[a-f0-9]{4}$ |default_ch = |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |is_manuf = |tpfirmware = OpenWrt (Was) |availability = Discontinued |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = 03/06/2013 |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = B008XD4BL0 |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |buttons = |led = |dimensions = |weight = |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1cpu = true |rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = |rad1txchains = 1 |rad1rxchains = 1 |rad1sstreams = 1 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n |rad1n = 150 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "MS-ME198407", "A1-V2.0+", and "A1-V2.1" is silkscreened on the multiple board types in the FCC photos. The FCC test report states that this FCC ID applies to the A1, A1+, A1B, A1S, A1W, A2, A2B, A2S, and A2W. Default settings are per the FCC manual. :The default SSID for the device is shown to be '''HAME_A1_XXXX'''. There are a fair number of entries for this SSID in '''WiGLE''' (generally / exclusively with 9C:41:7C OUIs). :The FCC manual also includes a list of compatibility tested 3G dongles. ==Flashing== {{Flashnotice}} ===Flashing OpenWrt=== {{OpenWrtNotice|notrecommended}} {{OpenWrtNotice|insufficient}} {{OpenWrtNotice|endsupport|2022|19.07.10}} {{OpenWrt |techdata = https://openwrt.org/toh/hwdata/hame/hame_mpr-a1 |wikipage = https://openwrt.org/toh/hame/mpr-a1 |forumpage = https://forum.openwrt.org/viewtopic.php?id=37002 |forumpage2 = |forumpage3 = |github = |target = ramips |subtarget = rt305x |arch = mipsel_24kc |support_started_version = 14.07 |current_supported_version = 19.07.10 |unsupportedfuncntions = |comment = Image build disabled in master with commit d7d46da938e3
